title-group.article-title: Rationality Problem of Three-Dimensional Purely Monomial Group Actions: The Last Case

abstract.p: A k-automorphism σ of the rational function field <tex-math>$k(x_1 ,...,x_n )$</tex-math> is called purely monomial if a sends every variable Xi to a monic Laurent monomial in the variables <tex-math>$x_1 ,...,x_n $</tex-math>. Let G be a finite subgroup of purely monomial k-automorphisms of <tex-math>$k(x_1 ,...,x_n )$</tex-math>. The rationality problem of the G-action is the problem of whether the G-fixed field <tex-math>$k(x_1 ,...,x_n )^G $</tex-math> is k- rational, i.e., purely transcendental over k, or not. In 1994, M. Hajja and M. Kang gave a positive answer for the rationality problem of the three-dimensional purely monomial group actions except one case. We show that the remaining case is also affirmative.
